titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: John Smith from the Island of Barbadoes, of the Methodist episcopal church—certificate, by Henry Baker Providence—wants aid to go home 50
Captain Matthias Rich, blind—with his Son—certificate of Dr Reynolds Boston 50.
Whitney—about the Railroad to the South Sea
Miss Saunders with a Letter from Abbott Lawrence to the Secretary of War Marcy, recommending her brother from Boston for a Cadets Warrant. very earnest for my name to the recommendation
Evening party at Mr Lunts.
Friday 24. Septr 1847.— Miss Cutts went to Boston and dined at Dr Warrens, and returned by the Cars at 6. O Clock

Mrs John Adams was confined the whole day to her bed by indisposition— Mrs J. Q. Adams, C. F. Adams his wife and daughter Louisa Catherine and Mary Louisa went to Boston this afternoon in the carriage to see the Italian Opera, of Hernany— They got home about half past eleven at night.
Blue chests N 4–6. 7. 8–10—at the farmhouse
N. 9. 11 12–14 on my bed chamber—
S. K. Lothrop and Mr Hincks an Irish English man.

1847. Sunday. 26. North-East storm.— Mr Lunt. Mark 1.3. and Matthew 13–18—[“]Hear ye therefore the parable of the Sower”— Mr Lunt gave notice that the communion will be administered next Sunday and the usual annual collection taken up— Also that the time of service will be changed to 1/2 past 10 A.M. and 1/4 before 3 (2) P.M.
Joseph H. Adams dined here.— Cold hands—

Monday 27. Septr— Visit from Jonathan Cumings from Plymouth on Merrimack river, New Hampshire father ofCumings of this town who lives in Anthony Baxters house— Letter from Joseph N. Brewer Roxbury with City Document N. 7. Public Cemetery.
Letter from R. C. Washington—22 Septr—is a candidate for doorkeeper HR.U.S. 30 Congress.
Letter from Freeman Hunt New-York Certificate for merchants Magazine.
Letter from H. G. Somerby upon New-England pedigrees

Tuesday 28 Septr 1847— Peter de Wandeleer—insane claiming to be a relation of Mr Van Vechten of Albany—also to come from the State of Ohio— Ride to South Braintree and Weymouth with Mrs C. F. Adams. Miss Cutts left us to take tea with Elizabeth C Adams— My Son passed the night at Boston

Wednesday 29 Septr 1847— Whig State convention at Springfield— C. F. A. attended it— Walk round the square— Ride with Mrs John, Mrs Charles and Mary to the biscuit baker’s at Milton— Mrs Charles evening here
Letter from J. W. Johnson Dartmouth College 25 Septr 47. asking for an autograph.

Mr Daniel M’Bride Graham, professor at the central College from of Michigan introduced by Letter from Rev John Pierce D.D. of Brookline— Comes with Mr. Jenkins of Roxbury— Dined up the hill with Mrs Charles—expecting my son but he did not come— Visit from Mrs Hale of Weathersfield, and her son Joseph of Boston— Mrs G. T. Bigelow—and Charles Miller going on Steamer Britannia to-morrow for England.
